title: Chili-Lime Grilled Shrimp
description: Quick, bright and smoky grilled shrimp tossed in a zesty chili-lime marinade. Ready in under 30 minutes, this recipe balances tangy citrus, garlic, and a touch of heat for a vibrant weeknight dinner or grill-side appetizer.

ingredients.display_name: large raw shrimp, peeled and deveined (16-20 count), tails on or off per preference
honey (or agave for strict keto replace with 1/2 tsp erythritol; optional)
ingredients.notes: adds balance to heat; omit for strict keto
about 1/2 tsp if finely ground and preferred

ingredients.display_name: wooden or metal skewers (if using wooden, soak 30 minutes)
ingredients.notes: about 2 shrimp per skewer for presentation

steps.text: Prepare shrimp by peeling and deveining as needed, then pat them very dry with paper towels to ensure marinade adheres and they sear rather than steam.
Make the marinade: whisk together lime juice, olive oil, minced garlic, honey (if using), chili powder, smoked paprika, ground cumin, kosher salt, and black pepper in a bowl until combined.
Combine shrimp and marinade in a resealable bag or shallow dish; toss to coat thoroughly. Refrigerate and let marinate briefly, 10 minutes maximum to avoid 'cooking' the shrimp in acid.
While shrimp marinates, soak wooden skewers in water for at least 30 minutes if using; preheat grill to medium-high (about 400-450°F / 200-230°C). Oil grill grates lightly to prevent sticking.
Thread shrimp onto skewers (if using) or place directly on a hot grill. Grill shrimp 2-3 minutes per side until opaque and just firm, flipping once; total cook time 4-6 minutes depending on size.
Remove shrimp from grill, transfer to a plate, sprinkle with chopped cilantro and lime zest if desired, and let rest 1-2 minutes before serving. Serve with extra lime wedges.
